org.stekikun.dolmen.syntax

Class Regular

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.stekikun.dolmen.syntax.Regular
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Regular.Alternate, Regular.Binding, Regular.Characters, Regular.Eof, Regular.Epsilon, Regular.Repetition, Regular.Sequence

    public abstract class Regular
extends Object
    Instances of Regular represent concrete regular expressions. They are immutable objects, and have therefore value semantics.
    Author:
    Stéphane Lescuyer

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Regular.Alternate
      Instances of regular expressions that represent a choice a | b between two regular expressions.
      static class  Regular.Binding
      Instances of regular expressions that represent expressions whose matchers will be bound to a specified name
      static class  Regular.Characters
      Instances of regular expressions that match exactly one character amongst a set of possible characters.
      static class  Regular.Eof
      The singleton class that stands for the regular expression matching the "end of input", or EOF, which only matches when the input string has been entirely consumed.
      static class  Regular.Epsilon
      The singleton class that stands for the empty regular expression ε, which only matches the empty string.
      static interface  Regular.Folder<V>
      An instance of Regular.Folder is a set of methods to apply to the various cases of a regular expression, depending on its form, as part of a (possibly) recursive traversal of the regular expression structure.
      static class  Regular.Gen
      Generates random regular expressions based on a probability configuration and a random number generator
      static class  Regular.Kind
      Enumeration which describes the different kinds of concrete implementations of Regular.
      static class  Regular.Repetition
      Instances of regular expressions that represent the Kleene closure r* of some regular expression r, i.e. matching zero, one or more repetitions of r
      static class  Regular.Sequence
      Instances of regular expressions that represent the concatenation ab of two regular expressions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Regular.Eof EOF
      The regular expression matching the end-of-file/end-of-input

      The empty regular expression ε

      Whether this regular expressions has any bound submatching group or not
      Regular.Kind kind
      Specifies what kind of regular expression this is
      boolean nullable
      Whether this regular expression matches the empty string.
      int size
      If size >= 0, all strings matching this regular expression have the specified size.

    • Field Detail

      • kind

        public final Regular.Kind kind
        Specifies what kind of regular expression this is

      • size

        public final int size
        If size >= 0, all strings matching this regular expression have the specified size. If size is negative, then no size is guaranteed.

      • hasBindings

        public final boolean hasBindings
        Whether this regular expressions has any bound submatching group or not

      • nullable

        public final boolean nullable
        Whether this regular expression matches the empty string.

        Note that the end-of-file regular expression does not match the empty string, it matches a special character instead.

      • EPSILON

        public static final Regular.Epsilon EPSILON
        The empty regular expression ε

      • EOF

        public static final Regular.Eof EOF
        The regular expression matching the end-of-file/end-of-input
